verbose_text: Consistent with work of XREF_BIBR, immunohistochemical analysis of femoral artery sections from wild-type mice showed that N-cadherin was barely detectable in uninjured arteries, but was strongly induced in the media and neointima following injury (XREF_FIG), with 80% of the mice having higher N-cadherin levels in injured arteries than in contralateral uninjured arteries (XREF_FIG).
